chlap.similar: chlapec, spolužiak, otec, učiteľ, syn, dedo, brat
chlap.general_note: Living masculine nouns ending in a consonant or -o.
chlap.nominative_note: Words in the nominative plural can also end with -ovia and -ia.

hrdina.general_note: Living masculine nouns ending in -a.
hrdina.nominative_note: Words ending in –ista have the ending -i in the nominative plural.

dub.general_note: Non-living masculine nouns ending in a hard or bilabial consonant.

stroj.general_note: Non-living masculine nouns ending in a soft consonant.

pes.general_note: Animal nouns ending in a hard or bilabial consonant.
pes.nominative_note: The form psi is for living | psy is for non-living.
pes.accusative_note: The form psi is for living | psy is for non-living.

medveď.general_note: Animal nouns ending in a soft consonant.
medveď.nominative_note: The form medvedi is for living | medvede if for non-living.
medveď.accusative_note: The form medvedi is for living | medvede if for non-living.

kuli.general_note: Masculine nouns that are foreign loanwords, masculine names and surnames ending with the vowels i, y, í, e, é, ä, ű, ö, ő

žena.general_note: Feminine nouns ending in -a after a hard or bilabial consonant.
žena.genitive_note: When we add no ending in the genitive plural, the root is elongated.

ulica.general_note: Feminine nouns ending in -a after a soft consonant.
ulica.genitive_note: When we add no ending in the genitive plural, the root is elongated.

dlaň.general_note: Feminine nouns ending in a consonant that in nominative plural ends in -e.

kosť.general_note: Feminine nouns ending in a consonant that in nominative plural ends in -i.

gazdiná.general_note: Feminine titles, mostly from the feudal period.

idea.general_note: Feminine nouns that are foreign loanwords ending in -ea, -oa, -ua.

mať.general_note: The word mať has its own declesions.

pani.general_note: The word pani has its own declesions (when combined with a proper noun it is not declined).

mesto.general_note: Neuter nouns ending in -o and foreign loanwords ending in -on or -um.

srdce.instrumental_note: Srdcami is modern form | srdciami is archaic form.

vysvedčenie.general_note: Neuter nouns ending in -ie (the suffixes are always long, the rhythmic rule is not observed.)

dievča.general_note: Neuter nouns ending in -a or -ä:
dievča.nominative_note: The forms dievčatá and dievčence are equal.
dievča.genitive_note: The forms dievčat and dievčeniec are equal.
dievča.dative_note: The forms dievčatám and dievčencom are equal.
dievča.accusative_note: The forms dievčatá and dievčence are equal.
dievča.locative_note: The forms dievčatách and dievčencoch are equal.
dievča.instrumental_note: The forms dievčatami and dievčencami are equal.

dieťa.general_note: The word dieťa has its own declesions.

on.genitive_with_prep_note: Neho is a separate word | -ňho | ň are suffixes.
on.accusative_with_prep_note:
Neho | ho are separate words | -ňho | ň are suffixes.
The form neho | -ňho is for living | ho | -ň if for non-living.

ono.genitive_with_prep_note: Neho is a separate word | -ňho | ň are suffixes.
ono.accusative_with_prep_note: Neho is a separate word | -ňho | ň are suffixes.

oni_ony.nominative_note: The form oni is for masculine living | ony if for non-living.
oni_ony.accusative_with_prep_note: The form nich is for masculine living | ne if for non-living.

môj.nominative_note: The form moji is for masculine living | moje if for non-living.
môj.accusative_note: The form mojich is for masculine living | moje if for non-living.

svoj.nominative_note: The form svoji is for masculine living | svoje if for non-living.
svoj.accusative_note: The form svojich is for masculine living | svoje if for non-living.

ten.nominative_note: The form tí is for masculine living | tie if for non-living.
ten.accusative_note: The form tých is for masculine living | tie if for non-living.

aký.nominative_note: The form akí is for masculine living | aké if for non-living.
aký.accusative_note: The form akých is for masculine living | aké if for non-living.

čí.nominative_note: The form čí is for masculine living | čie if for non-living.
čí.accusative_note: The form čích is for masculine living | čie if for non-living.

pekný.general_note: Adjectives with hard ending (-ý | -y) in nominative singular masculine.
pekný.genitive_note: The form pekní is for masculine living | pekné if for non-living.
pekný.locative_note: The form pekných is for masculine living | pekné if for non-living.

cudzí.general_note: Adjectives with hard ending (-í | -i) in nominative singular masculine.
cudzí.genitive_note: The form cudzí is for masculine living | cudzie if for non-living.
cudzí.locative_note: The form cudzích is for masculine living | cudzie if for non-living.

páví.general_note: Declension for animal adjectives. The suffixes remain long and the rhythmic rule is not observed.
páví.genitive_note: The form páví is for masculine living | pávie if for non-living.
páví.locative_note: The form pávích is for masculine living | pávie if for non-living.

otcov.general_note: Adjectives with -ov ending in nominative singular masculine.
otcov.genitive_note: The form otcovi is for masculine living | otcove if for non-living.
otcov.locative_note: The form otcových is for masculine living | otcove if for non-living.

matkin.general_note: Adjectives with -in ending in nominative singular masculine.
matkin.genitive_note: The form matkini is for masculine living | matkine if for non-living.
matkin.locative_note: The form matkiných is for masculine living | matkine if for non-living.

jeden.nominative_note: The form jedni is for masculine living | jedny if for non-living.
jeden.accusative_note: The form jedných is for masculine living | jedny if for non-living.

dva.nominative_note: The form dvaja is for masculine living | dva is for masculine non-living | dve if for non-living.
dva.accusative_note: The form dvoch is for masculine living | dva is for masculine non-living | dve if for non-living.
dva.instrumental_note: The form dvoma is for masculine living | dvomi if for non-living.

tri.nominative_note: The form traja is for masculine living | tri if for non-living.
tri.accusative_note: The form troch is for masculine living | tri if for non-living.
tri.instrumental_note: The form troma is for masculine living | tromi if for non-living.

štyri.nominative_note: The form štyria is for masculine living | štyri if for non-living.
štyri.accusative_note: The form štyroch is for masculine living | štyri if for non-living.

päť.nominative_note: The form piati is for masculine living | päť if for non-living.
päť.accusative_note: The form piatich is for masculine living | päť if for non-living.
